Welcome to the the Columbia Biostatistics Computing Club!

The group is run by Julia Wrobel and Ariel Chernofsky under faculty advisor Christine Mauro in the Department of Biostatistics at Columbia University.

We host causal monthly seminars focusing on computational topics often encountered in Biostatistics research. The tutorials provide hands-on learning at a variety of skill levels, with some focused on bringing new students up to speed and others addressing more advanced problems. Our overarching goal is to impart good programming practices that encourage collaborative reproducible research!

Spring 2017 Schedule

  • January 19: Introduction to R and R Markdown with Ariel Chernofsky and Hyung Park
  • February 23: The beauty of ggplot2 with Jihui Lee
  • March 23: Interactive visualization using RStudio's Shiny with Julia Wrobel
  • April 20: Using GitHub for collaboration and version control with Jeff Goldsmith

Find R markdown files for past topics under resources tab.
